column4: Hello. I have a user account on an ubuntu machine and i am compiling software that requires libcppunit, however it is not installed on the system. What would be the standard method to notify the (configure) that some of the libraries are installed in some directory like /home/me/opt/libcppunit ?
this is often done by adding the path to /etc/ld.so.conf.  You might also have a look at the LDFLAGS env variable.
i will try with LDFLAGS and CFLAGS, i wouldn't have permission to /etc/ld.so.conf
Cool.  also LD_LIBRARY_PATH is one more you may want.
